title_sort: bethuel smith to walt whitman, 12 march 1875
title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 12 March 1875
text: QueensburyMarch 12th/74Dear friendI received your letter last weak[week] & was glad to hear from you I received some papers about three weaks[weeks] ago last summer I was in brooklyn & I hunted for you but could not find you I mad[made] up my mind that I would not hear from you again but I have I received your picture & I thought it too look natural it is night now & I was agoing to the village tomorrow so I thought I would write A few lines to you my helth[health] is good & so is my families I have got three boys & one girlthe way that I came to be in brooklyn I was last summer & we went to new york new jersey brooklyn port morris newark new jersey & several places but did not do any thing of worth in any of the places I talk some of canoeing this summer but don't now[know] for certain yet I wat[want] you to tell me where Camden is whether it is in the upper or lower part jersey or off towards newark so that if I do come down there I can find you I would like to see you verry[very] much last fall I bought A small farm & paid fifty dollars down & fifty this spring it makes pretty hard time with me this spring I am owing some debt that I dont[don't] no[know] whether I can pay them or not this spring one of my horses is so lame that I cant[can't] work him & I have every thing to buy I have got one cow & the two sheep that is all of my stock youre[your] letters was directed rite[right] the two firts[first] years of my mairage[marriage] my wife was sick the most of the time so it used up what money that I had then but her health has ben[been] verry[very] well since thenBethuel Smiththere was so much sun this winter that it has ben[been] bad gitting[getting] around in this part of the country the snow is about 4 feat[feet] deep now in the woods but not so deep in the fields I like your peaces[pieces] in the paper verry[very] much I am to pay four hundred dollars for 39 3/4 acres of land A small house & barn on it I dont now[know] as I can think of anny[any] more to write at present So good buy[bye] for this timethis is fromBethuel Smith your friend Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 12 March 1875
